title: Lack of variety in competitive League....
body:
I really enjoy watching competitive leauge of legends at the highest level but the lack of variety is starting to bother me.  Why is there only a pool of around 20 champs that the best players will choose in these games?  I realize that the way the game is there is always going to be a pool of champs that are played more than others but it would be awesome if they could get that number up to 30 and even 40+ in the long term.  The games are still entertaining but everyone gets so exicited when a wild card pick comes in because it adds so much variety to the game.  

Is this something Riot is aware of and working on?

replies.body:
Yep, no diversity. Hecarim Top/Mid. Urgot Mid/ADC, Fizz Jungle/Top, Morg Top/Mid/Support, Naut Jung/Support, Liss Top/Mid TF, Corki Mid/Adc Senju/Zac/Kat,Mundo, Trundle, Anivia (Thank you Faker), and so many other champions.

NA: 55 Unique Champions Used
EU: 53 Unique Champions Used
CN: 53 Unique Champions Used
KR: 62 Unique Champions Used

I also have to say, Leviathan (Coach of Gambit Gaming) is awesome. He considers all Champions Viable but when a player comes to him saying they want to play a champion, he asks them what they bring to a comp. If they don't fit the role for the comp the player says that champion fits, he tells them to think on it more. Best Coach that wasn't a Pro!

53 unique champs have been played in the spring split alone.

If you look at unique champs played for the past year, it ends up being about 80% of the champ roster.
